act_info.full_title: Ontario Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Corporation Act, 2023, S.O. 2023, c. 2, Sched. 7
act_info.act_name_text: Ontario Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Corporation Act, 2023

content.content: 1 In this Act, “Minister” means the Solicitor General or such other member of the Executive Council as may be assigned the administration of this Act under the Executive Council Act; (“ministre”) “Society” means the Ontario Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals. (“Société”)
content.raw_html:
1 In this Act,

“Minister” means the Solicitor General or such other member of the Executive Council as may be assigned the administration of this Act under the Executive Council Act; (“ministre”)

“Society” means the Ontario Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals. (“Société”)

content.section: Ontario Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals continued
content.content: 2 The Ontario Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals, a body corporate incorporated by An Act to Incorporate the Ontario Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals, being chapter 124 of the Statutes of Ontario, 1919, is continued as a corporation without share capital under the name Ontario Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals in English and Société de protection des animaux de l’Ontario in French.
content.raw_html: 2 The Ontario Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals, a body corporate incorporated by An Act to Incorporate the Ontario Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals, being chapter 124 of the Statutes of Ontario, 1919, is continued as a corporation without share capital under the name Ontario Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals in English and Société de protection des animaux de l’Ontario in French.

content.content: 3 (1) The Minister may make regulations, (a) governing any matters related to the governance of the Society, including prescribing, (i) the purposes of the Society, (ii) the membership of the Society, (iii) the composition, powers and operation of the board of directors of the Society, (iv) the capacity, rights, powers and privileges of the Society, (v) the dissolution of the Society, including the distribution of any remaining property of the Society on dissolution, (vi) any other matters related to the constitution and management of the Society; (b) governing any transitional matters that may arise due to the continuation of the Society or the enactment of this Act. Retroactive (2) A regulation made under this section is, if it so provides, effective with reference to a period before it is filed. Note: Section 4 comes into force on a day to be named by proclamation of the Lieutenant Governor. Repeal of Act 4 This Act is repealed. 5 Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Act). 6 Omitted (enacts short title of this Act).  Français
content.raw_html:
3 (1) The Minister may make regulations,

(a) governing any matters related to the governance of the Society, including prescribing,

(i) the purposes of the Society,

(ii) the membership of the Society,

(iii) the composition, powers and operation of the board of directors of the Society,

(iv) the capacity, rights, powers and privileges of the Society,

(v) the dissolution of the Society, including the distribution of any remaining property of the Society on dissolution,

(vi) any other matters related to the constitution and management of the Society;

(b) governing any transitional matters that may arise due to the continuation of the Society or the enactment of this Act.

Retroactive

(2) A regulation made under this section is, if it so provides, effective with reference to a period before it is filed.

Note: Section 4 comes into force on a day to be named by proclamation of the Lieutenant Governor.

Repeal of Act

4 This Act is repealed.

5 Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Act).

6 Omitted (enacts short title of this Act).

 

Français
